message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class TestStringToken {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String str = "tajmahal.txt sarjan.pdf noorjahan.exe";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str, " ");

        String[] arr = new String[st.countTokens()];
        int i = 0;
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            arr[i++] = st.nextToken();
        }

        for (String s : arr) {
            System.out.println(s);
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class is used to break a string into tokens. In this case, we are using the space character as the delimiter to break the string into tokens. The countTokens() method is used to get the total number of tokens. We then create a string array of the same size. The while loop is used to iterate through the tokens and store each token in the array. The for-each loop is then used to print the elements of the array.
